availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Francis Triplett Hord, Sr. (Mason County, Kentucky, attorney)

body.p: Mason County, Kentucky, attorney. Kentucky native. Son of Elias Hord and Ann Triplett Hord. Married to Elizabeth Scott Moss Hord. Father of Oscar Hord, William Hord, George Hord, Francis Triplett Hord, Jr., Elias Hord, Moss Hord, Kendal Hord, Henry Hord, and Josephine Hord. Attorney in Mason County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned nine enslaved persons in Mason County in 1850. Attorney in Mason County in 1860. Owned eighteen enslaved persons in Mason County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, District 2, p. 95A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, District 2.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, District 2, p. 160.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, District 2, p. 15B.
Lineage Books: National Society of the Daughters of the American Revolution, vol. CIV (Washington, D.C.: Judd & Detweiler, Inc., 1928), 204.
